channel.title: Development, Git on Summitt Dweller's Blog

item.title: Fixing a Broken GitHub Repo
item.description: Don’t Push Enormous Files to GitHub! Pay close attention to the statement above! A couple of days ago I was working on content for Tama-Toledo Community Visioning and I added a large socialmedia.zip file to the source repo, and then very stupidly pushed it to GitHub and the repo’s main branch. Naturally, the push didn’t finish so I removed the file and pushed a new commit to “remove it permanently”. Well, that ain’t how git works!
